website_summaries.verdict: Comfort is the positive point that mainly impressed KEEN Voyageur Mid buyers. It is also loved for its versatility and excellent ankle support. On the other hand, the shoe was heavily criticized for its underperforming sole unit. To conclude, the boot may have enough good points, but the quality of the sole might render consumers unsatisfied.
pros: Several wide-footed people were delighted with the accommodating fit of the KEEN Voyageur Mid
It’s a great boot right out of the box
A lot of testers confirmed that breaking it in is no longer necessary
The traction of the Voyageur Mid was excellent, as mentioned by a handful of owners
Numerous outdoor enthusiasts appreciated it for being lightweight
The boot’s sufficient ankle support gave many hikers peace of mind
They need not worry about sustaining ankle-related injuries when tackling uneven grounds
Some users lauded the breathability of the Voyageur Mid as it was able to keep a fresh in-shoe feel
Its ability to dry quickly after being submerged in water was fascinating, based on a number of customer reviews
Hordes of wearers commended its versatility
Aside from being an outdoor boot, its style works in casual settings
cons: The bottom tread of the sole wore out easily and the lugs started peeling back after a few months of use, according to a couple of annoyed wearers
Some didn’t like its insufficient underfoot protection
The sole of the Voyageur Mid separated from the upper too soon which discouraged many users from purchasing another KEEN footwear
A small number of hikers experienced bad blistering with this boot

customer_reviews.title: Extremely durable
customer_reviews.text: 6 years...I've worn these boots everyday for 6 years, and I'd continue to wear them except the bottom rubber heels have finally fallen off and they are slip hazards now. This is my 2nd pair of keens in 10 years, extremely durable, fit perfect...it's almost like wearing a slipper or moccasin...I slip them on and off, work in a warehouse for 10 hrs a day and go home and do yardwork...great pair of boots, I'll bury them in the back yard along with all my beloved pets!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are wonderful and 'my friend' I tuck the long lace ears ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm not one for blue jeans/hiking boots or reviews. BUT ordered these boots for trip to Israel. Have you any idea how many rocks/boulders are in Israel??!! I lovethese boots! no twisted ankles, they are light (for packing) I am now a hiking boot kinda gal. These are wonderful and 'my friend' I tuck the long lace ears down into the twisted laces at front of boot so they don't 'catch' as they one-time did. I am a size 11 so bought a man's 10 and put my orthotic inside. I can't say enough nice things about this boot. Thanks, Keen
customer_reviews.author: millie

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent sizing for years now
customer_reviews.text: Keen over the past 5 years or so has inconsistencies in their sizing. Keen has been my preferred shoe for over 10 years but find myself battling sizzling issues. I currently have three old pairs at 11 1/2. I just ordered three new at the same size. One fits perfect but the other two are small. This problem I have faced now at least 7 times over the last 5 years. If you order keen, be aware you will probably have to exchange for a different size
customer_reviews.author: bryan

customer_reviews.title: Moderate price point in sole (improvement)
customer_reviews.text: First time owning the mid high Keen. Have several of this model in the low top. First time that insole was not the crepe paper insole. It's yellow, may be the lowest of the Keen aftermarket insoles. Likely I will still update to the Timberland Pro insoles. Easier on my feet on hard/concrete. Still leaves enough room for medium socks (more cushion). Found the tongue lighter/thinner than the low top. No idea if this is to reduce bunching or a price point. Has yet to impact my comfort level. Have been waterproof so far. Winter (snow and light mud). I wear rubber boots when I know I am going to be in the muck.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Voyageur vs Targhee
customer_reviews.text: These replaced the mid Targhee ones I was wearing. The Targhees cramped my long toes, but these let them fly. They are also cooler and grip my foot more around the ankle. Also the Targhees were rubbing my little toes raw, but these have been just fine that way, mostly because I think they grab my foot further back. The heel lock on these has been wonderful as I have narrow heels. I use Dr. Schols inserts with them because I need the extra arch.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Norris

customer_reviews.title: Great Hiking Boots That Breathe!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for summer hiking and they are just what I needed for that. I have worn Keen shoes for a couple of years and they fit better than any other outdoor footwear than I have ever had. These were no exception. I wear custom orthotic inserts and they fit very well in these hikers. They are not waterproof but I knew that going in; in fact that is why I bought them. Waterproof hikers are way too hot for my feet in summer and these breathe much better than ones with a waterproof liner. Well made and very durable. The shoelaces even stay tied! Highly recommend Keen footwear.
customer_reviews.author: Hambone33

customer_reviews.title: My go to work shoe
customer_reviews.text: This is like my 5th pair and I’m going to order another pair when these wear out. I use them to work doing landscaping and morning dew is a shoes worst enemy. These hold up much better because of the rubber toe and they are very comfortable from the get go. I always upgrade the insoles on any of my work shoes so I can’t speak to the insole comfort but it does seem a little thin. The soles do come unglued but nothing a little shoe goop can’t remedy. They could figure out why the hell that keeps happening and fix it but until then I haven’t found a better replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin D.

customer_reviews.title: KEEN just does it right
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying and exclusively using keens boots for hiking and work for more than 10 years and they are just excellent. Always comfortable from the moment you put them on, very durable also. I've hiked up to 16 mile days on many Colorado trails and have never had a fail, blister or foot pain which I would regularly experience with my Merrel or Vasque boots. Good quality boots worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Fit as expected. Shoelaces are too long, but  stay tied
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Have worn a few weeks. Seem very durable. I have not noticed any signs of glue coming loose, referenced in other reviews. Shoelaces stay tied, but are a bit long. Not sure why they are so long as there is nowhere to wrap them around your ankle or anything like that. I really like the design of the shoelaces however, as they are bumpy which helps them stay tied. You will just need to talk the shoe tie bows in really well as they can catch the highest plastic grommet on the other shoe and trip you up.
customer_reviews.author: druegray@gmail.com

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for summer trail hiking. I have had many boots over the years and they usually become comfortable once broken in. When I first put these on they immediately felt already broken in. Support and traction are good. I would not use them for serious mountaineering, but for roads, trails, and for occasional boonie-bashing they are great.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Morris

customer_reviews.title: Let’s water and dirt in
customer_reviews.text: Pretty comfortable boots, but they leak like a colander. They are definitely not water resistant like the listing says. Water rolls right in. Hiking through dewy grass and your feet are soaked immediately. Might as well be wearing sandals. They breathe great though. So if you’re only using them in dry conditions, that’s ok. But they also let dust and dirt in. So your socks are filthy. Would not recommend
customer_reviews.author: T. Mathieson

customer_reviews.title: Out of the box and onto the trail!
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic! Right out of the box, no break in period required. Just lace these brilliant boots around your favorite socks (Wigwam in the warmer months, Darn tuff for winter) and hit the trail. Wide and protective toe box, good traction and comfortable ankle support. Great laces and lacing system. Perhaps they're not the most durable, but you'll get a solid season of hiking out of them. I probably got about 300 miles, maybe more, before I decided to "refresh". Maybe they're not for 15k hikers, but for 46ers, and day hikers, the best boots I've owned. I live with the fear that Keen will discontinue these boots.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Markes

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be end of production, factory seconds.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair of these boots, this particular pair through Amazon are pretty clearly factory seconds. The glue is sloppy, a good size mark on the rear of the right heel, stamp marks in the leather from stitching, etc. They're getting hard to find and I like the particular kind of boot so I'll use them and abuse them accordingly. If you want a new-and-shiny version of a former favorite boot, these aren't that, look for a new style.
customer_reviews.author: Doobfucious

customer_reviews.title: Top 5 best shoes I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: I am a lawn care pro and use these as work boots, alternating with my other favorite brand.(Merrell) These shoes are near perfect in fit, finish, durability, and comfort. I will buy these shoes again in the future when they finally wear out. Give them a try and you will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Used, dirty and scratched boots received!
customer_reviews.text: The worst experience ever. I received my order yesterday and they were ordered for a gift. There is no way a am going to give these to someone, they look old, used, muddy and scratched! I don't understand they were ordered "new"!
customer_reviews.author: denise23

customer_reviews.title: Excellent price and fit!!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit and comfortable as Keen boot usually are. This one is lightweight and strong for hiking steep trails and rocky terrain. I have become very accustomed to wearing Keen for work, hiking, hunting. This are comfortable for every day -- all day -- casual wear in summer and light winter.
customer_reviews.author: osspear

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots!
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this boot. There are lots of favorable reviews so i decided on them and they are simply great. it honestly felt like i put a recliner on my feet they are so comfortable. The break in time was very very minimal if necessary at all, one week of wearing them to the office on thin carpet and concrete sidewalks, then off to the mountains. Three days and 23 miles of sand, mud, and rugged uphill terrain, zero blisters and the boot still looks great, other than dirty of course. My feet didn't seem to get too hot either, they are breathable. So definitely five stars!!
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: Not wide enough
customer_reviews.text: Had to return the boots I read reviews that said the width was bigger then normal wasn't the case at all. If you have wide feet find a pair a keens that have that option these are standard width at best, but seemed like a decent boot
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Since 2017, Fit perfect since day one
customer_reviews.text: This is a great boot. I have worn it daily for everything since 2017. From their intended purpose of hiking in sand and mountains to going walks around town and shoveling 2ft of snow. Yes your feet will get wet, their not WP. 8.5m Fit perfect for me with a 8.5 wide feet. The sole, laces, eyelets and hooks all look good normal wear. I am planning on buying them again.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Prewitt

customer_reviews.title: Too small, had to return
customer_reviews.text: They said order true to your size. I wear and 11, but on some tennis shoes I have to order 11.5. So I ordered 11.5. But on these boots, my toes were pushing into the end. No way to hike in these.
customer_reviews.author: William M.

customer_reviews.title: It's a comfortable, solid shoe
customer_reviews.text: It's a comfortable, solid shoe. It looks great and feels great. It's not too tight in the toe area, which I've found to be a problem with other shoes. I've put about 40 miles on them so far, and they're holding up great. I'm glad I bought them.
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Boots received were sized incorrectly and Keen customer support was ...
customer_reviews.text: Boots received were sized incorrectly and Keen customer support was not helpful. After hiking the AT trail over 1000 miles with a similar pair I expected the same quality. I was dissatisfied with both quality and customer support from Keen. I would strongly consider Salomon if looking for a trial shoe/boot. I completed the AT this year in a pair of Salomon trail shoes which they shipped to me at no charge and provided me a 100% guarantee.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: fit good, nice
customer_reviews.text: only complaint is when you use the "top" lace catch thing and tie them normally, sometimes the lace will slip over the tongue... not a huge issue, but would be annoying if hiking
customer_reviews.author: Cleatus

customer_reviews.title: Did not hold up as other pair from local store
customer_reviews.text: Fit differently than one bought at local store and they wore out faster not sure why ?
customer_reviews.author: BrendaAmazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They're pretty rugged at least for general use - work
customer_reviews.text: Took me a while to get used to Keen and the square toe box. Now I won't go back to pointy shoes. They're pretty rugged at least for general use - work, every day walking, light hiking, and summer camp.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Graham

customer_reviews.title: Good year round boot
customer_reviews.text: These are really well made boots. I was surprised that they are so light weight, which is important since I have a prosthetic leg. Compared to my old work boots by Timberland and Wolverine, these are like wearing pillows on my feet. Despite the mesh sides, I still get by for an hour or so while shoveling the driveway in single degree temps. I just ordered the Detroit Soft Work boots to deal with being able to withstand higher snow totals and hopefully be able to spend more time outside without freezing my "real" foot. I'll let ya know how they work out.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick OConnor

customer_reviews.title: They are superior quality. If you are looking for a great ...
customer_reviews.text: I wear these almost everyday. They are superior quality. If you are looking for a great quality shoe, here they are. I work in and out of an office environment....50% of the time inside and 50% of the time outside. The comfort of these shoes are great. I cannot say anything bad about these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Tim D

customer_reviews.title: Heels tear up my feet
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so I can't wear these at all. I have purchased 4 pairs of Keens over the last 16 years without an issue, always the same size. This pair basically tears up my heels. I can't seem to get in contact with the seller, but I have to say that it was a waste of my money. They just sit in my closet unused now.
customer_reviews.author: Grant Ford

customer_reviews.title: otherwise they're pretty good. They are lightweight and they vent well
customer_reviews.text: They are not made in the USA and they were advertised as WP-they are not. Otherwise they will work for dry days. They are a little over priced for what they are especially when they not as advertised. I wish they had a little more cushion in the sole, otherwise they're pretty good. They are lightweight and they vent well. Time will tell if they fall apart and I hope the support does not go flat.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Wallis

customer_reviews.title: Good foot fit but...
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is really nice, fits well around the foot, but be prepared for the extra pressure on the achilles tendon. I’m experiencing discomfort there while wearing them. Its been a while since I've had a shoe that was over the ankle so i’m gonna give it a couple weeks to adjust. Hopefully the discomfort subsides, if not i’ll seek a return/exchange.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Hinkle

customer_reviews.title: Soles separated almost immediately.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots for a two week trip and the soles separated from the boot after four days on the trail. I tried to re-fix the sole to the boot using a glue that a local shop recommended but didn't wear them much afterwards. I pulled them out recently and wore them for three days and the rest of the sole separated and is now held only by the replacement glue. Normally Keen's are wonderful but this model simply did not hold up for me. I would recommend another style.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots.  Best Keens Ever!!
customer_reviews.text: Great Boots and at a great price. Already have one pair that are getting pretty beat. I think Keen has discontinued them so I figured I grab another pair before they are gone. Found my size 12 as an Amazon Warehouse Deal for almost $50 off the new price. And they came as new. Don't even look like they were tried on. Perfect!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Osswald

customer_reviews.title: Great fit!
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots! They are my second pair. The first pair gave out after around 500 miles. I walk 2 miles most mornings for exercise. I love the support, toe box, lightness, overall fit of these boots. When I wear these out I will buy another pair
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Consistency would be nice
customer_reviews.text: I've had 9-1/2 Keens that have held up to daily wear for the past 2 years, so I bought another pair. The new size 9-1/2 fit like a size 9.
customer_reviews.author: TJB

customer_reviews.title: Excellent hiking boots. Light, durable, dry fast, sure grip, no break in needed.
customer_reviews.text: I love Keen hiking boots. They are ready to hike right out of the box requiring little break in. If you wear a liner and medium thickness hiking socks you'll need to order a full size larger than your street shoes. Otherwise your toes will hit the front of the boot and after 12 miles, you'll be unhappy. Keens have a large toe box which means I don't need to order wide widths. My last pair of Voyageurs lasted about 500 miles on the AT and countless miles of training. Excellent boots. I do recommend some quality inserts though. That's advice applicable to any boot.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisW

customer_reviews.title: Great support and long lasting
customer_reviews.text: My dad uses these as work boots. He manages a welding shop so he has to be on his feet all day on concrete. These are the ONLY boots that give him the support and longevity he needs. He is SO picky about his boots, I’ve seen him spend over an hour at Academy and still leave with nothing, but a friend recommended these and he’s used them ever since. This is his third pair.
customer_reviews.author: Maddie66

customer_reviews.title: does not hold up
customer_reviews.text: I had this same shoe in the ankle height and this shoe fits exactly the same. very well made and sturdy. has held up well wearing in the snow but any water will get through, highly recommend update: I have been wearing this shoe for less than 6 months, I love the boot but it does not hold up, the heals are coming apart
customer_reviews.author: bshrove

customer_reviews.title: Great boots!
customer_reviews.text: Love these, my second pair, and I will have another. Love the fit, even though my feet can be tough. Wide toe, high arch and narrow ankle. These seem broken in out of the box. Good for 3 seasons, the side vents make them a bit chilly in winter weather.
customer_reviews.author: Adam J Laiewski

customer_reviews.title: Non-Pointy-Toe-Boots (as in cowboy)
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair, wore out the first, so I guess that might tell you something. I've Celtic feet and by that I mean several of the toes on each of my feet are almost as long as the big toes. They all reach the finish line toes to toes and nose to nose. Picture a duck foot, sorta kinda. So I need boots that give my toes a bit of room sideways whilst the sides of the boot snuggles up to the sides of me narrow feet. My Keens do that and more. No need to break them in, they're good to go from the get go. Very comfy, nice spring to the step.... Etc.
customer_reviews.author: Jose C. Cisneros

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: So far they are doing well. That being said I've only worn them for one camping / backpacking trip. I did order half a size larger (I'm a 10.5 in almost everything but ordered 11) and the size is perfect. Toes did well downhill, no heel rub and the roomy toe box keen is known for is perfect for my wide feet. My fear on these is durability so I'll have to update after some uses. I'm glad I got the regular vs waterproof since I'll do most of my hikes in south Texas.
customer_reviews.author: ernest guzman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Hiking boot
customer_reviews.text: These keens are the best. I have five pairs... and they cannot be beat, especially if you are narrower in the back of your foot and need more room at the toe. I prefer these boots to my 300+ dollar Asolo Leather hiking boots.
customer_reviews.author: Hrothgar J

customer_reviews.title: Like them.
customer_reviews.text: Good shoes. Seems they lack a little lateral stability though. They have a roomy toebox, fit slightly large, but sinching down the laces works well. VERY airy...breath well...feet don't sweat too much...love that...but the down side to hat is not waterproof: can't have both I guess.
customer_reviews.author: J just J

customer_reviews.title: This is my second pair of Keen mid hiking boots ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Keen mid hiking boots. The first pair fell apart a few years back, and I decided to go with a different brand. So some years passed and I decided to give Keen another try. 14 months of casual almost daily wear, and they are falling apart too. The sole is peeling away from the boot. The inside material is disintegrating in the heel of the boot. Learned my lesson, no more Keen for me.
customer_reviews.author: Mojo

customer_reviews.title: Welcome back Voyageurs.
customer_reviews.text: I first bought Voyageurs years ago and sadly stopped buying them because they were meant for hiking and were not very good on slick surfaces. I now need shoes for snow and mud and thought to give these a try. They’re as comfortable as always and expect them to be just what I need.
customer_reviews.author: Texas boy

customer_reviews.title: durable
customer_reviews.text: I'm a heavy guy and I wear these out in about a year or so, they are great to work in
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Sather

customer_reviews.title: 2nd Pair of these nice boots
customer_reviews.text: 2nd pair of these. I have had 3 different models but the Voyageur holds up the best. Not waterproof but fits the best and wears the best. Only 4 stars because not waterproof. Good year round boot. I play Disc Golf and they work very well for that as well as hiking.
customer_reviews.author: aktmjcor

customer_reviews.title: These fit better and support better than every other pair of Keen ...
customer_reviews.text: I had been wearing Keen casual boots for a few years now, with some fitting and supporting well, and others less well. These fit better and support better than every other pair of Keen boots I've ever worn. I think I'll order these again when I wear them out. I got one small blister on my Achilles tendon on one foot the first day I wore them, but as soon as that healed, they have been perfect for walking around all day.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Great boots.
customer_reviews.text: The first pair of these boots that I owned lasted 10 years. The soles finally wore out, but other than that they were still in good shape. They were my primary footwear in fall, winter and spring when I wasn't working so they were fairly heavily used. Had to get another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Rando33

customer_reviews.title: A higher version of an already good product.
customer_reviews.text: This is the boot equivalent of shoes I already have and like. The higher top gives more ankle protection for more vigorous hiking, the "strap" system of ties allows for adjustability in the foot, for those of us with irregular feet. I like the color, too. Unfortunately, Keen's has discontinued this item, so I have to get it from other sources.
customer_reviews.author: Autumnchild

customer_reviews.title: These are extremely comfortable and hold up well
customer_reviews.text: These are extremely comfortable and hold up well. I manage a warehouse and my phone says that I walk at least 12,000 steps a day, even after nine months they still feel great. I can be on my feet for 10 hours at work and my feet don't hurt when I get home. I first wore them with cotton athletic socks, but found they fit better with a slightly thicker boot sock. Overall a great boot...even better when you consider the price isn't through the roof.
customer_reviews.author: HW

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking boot
customer_reviews.text: I settled for a color I wouldn't have normally chosen, as it was $35 cheaper than the other choices.. I tried wearing them as is, but I require a bit more support, so I had to use my inserts too. They kept my feet warm and dry during our hikes in CA. I already put many miles on them and hope to put many more.
customer_reviews.author: Lori H

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: Not as sturdy as my Taghee's, Its says not waterproof and they mean it. I think i expected more for a trail hiker.
customer_reviews.author: NB

customer_reviews.title: Separating sole.
customer_reviews.text: Fit great , looked great. However, out of the box the sole was separated from the boot near the toe.
customer_reviews.author: Trash Man

customer_reviews.title: Lacing a bit tough
customer_reviews.text: A bit tough to get laces thru top hooks (I think they are meant to have a slight snap to get them in) and then keep the laces over the tongue for tying.
customer_reviews.author: R. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: After only wearing two weeks, 8 working days, the sole is tearing away from the shoe. Climbing in and out of a truck should not cause this damage.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: No Gore-Tex. Not waterproof.
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and good fitting but Not waterproof at all. There is No Gore-Tex membrane as Amazon advertised. I guess these are meant for dry, hot hiking only.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Toe box room great.
customer_reviews.text: Very light. I was surprised how comfortable they are. I never buy boots with out trying them on first. I found out they are not water proof when I stepped in a puddle.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Husband says they are "perfect!"
customer_reviews.text: While normally a size 11 we had to return that size for a size 11.5 - and husband says they are PERFECT!. Lightweight, airy and offering excellent support, these hikers have put the spring back in his step. After three foot surgeries, it's a great feeling to know he can find some relief with this quality built and comfortable boot. Thank you KEEN for a fabulous product and thank you AMAZON ... FANTASTIC RETURN POLICY and super-fast shipping -- as always.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good work boot
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my son, he likes them especially for summer.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa L. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Keen men's hiking boot.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a size 12, as most shoes I now buy are 11 1/2 or 12 in size. The Keen size 12, however, was the same length as my size 11 Danner hiking boots. I bought the Keen boots because of the large toe box. The box is good and I think the boots will be comfortable, when I get a bit lager size. Long downhill hiking with weight on ones back requires a good 1⁄2 space in front of the toes.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Hendricks

customer_reviews.title: They fit true to size
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my husband as we do alot of hiking ..He really liked the hi top it fit well around his ankle and gave him great support . We love keen I also bought myself a pair..( 2 pair )
customer_reviews.author: beth sykes

customer_reviews.title: Not Quite
customer_reviews.text: I have two pairs of Keen boots that I swear by. Tough, comfortable. Exceptional footwear. I ordered these hikers the same size. I had to send the first ones back for a size larger. With the proper size, the upper edge of the upper hits right on Achilles' tendon. Blister on first wear. The styling of the shoes is great. They look great. Function is a little less than I expected with Keen.
customer_reviews.author: the cat man

customer_reviews.title: Vented for summer heat!
customer_reviews.text: I have been searching for a boot that would not make my feet so hot while working outside in summer months. This boot is vented and is the best I have found!!! I have worn them for two weeks now and my feet do not get hot, the boots are comfortable, and very light weight. So far they are holding up very well and I would buy them again!
customer_reviews.author: OK

customer_reviews.title: Sole falling apart after a few wears
customer_reviews.text: I owned a previous pair of Keen boots that made it about 18 months before the sole tread glue gave out and started to fall apart. I ordered another pair given the comfort of the boot and thought 18 months was a reasonable lifespan. The new boot sole has already started to come unglued near the arch of both feet, and its been about 6 weeks. Not what one would expect from $100 boots
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love keen boots
customer_reviews.text: I love keen boots. These ones dont have waterproofing so my feet stay cooler, but these are a little larger than my other pair and they are both supposed to be 10 1/2. Its not enough that i would get a smaller size, but i have to wear thicker socks.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: but needed better ankle support
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing the low cut Voyageurs for many years, but needed better ankle support. The Targhee Mid that's I've tried as a waterproof alternative are too small, so I was worried about the Voyageur Mid. Happily the Voyageur Mid fit me perfectly. They are providing the desired support, and I'm so comfortable in them that they are now my primary footwear.
customer_reviews.author: Josiah Bartlett

customer_reviews.title: Comfy
customer_reviews.text: While most hiking boots are ugly, and they’re no exception...they are literally the most comfortable shoe I own. I loved them in the Shawnee National Forest and Runyon in LA.
customer_reviews.author: Comedy Central Web-based Applications

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable for days.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome backpacking boot. Got these while a good deal was going on, so my review is also based on that lowered cost. At retail there might be better options for you. I put Copper Super Feet in mine and they are perfect. Only 1 season so far, but I have high expectations they will last many seasons.
customer_reviews.author: John Bader

customer_reviews.title: Quality of this product is poor.
customer_reviews.text: I've always like Keen boots, but this is probably my last pair do to quality. One year and they have fallen apart. Will try an all leather product.
customer_reviews.author: D.O.

customer_reviews.title: What happened to this company????
customer_reviews.text: In less than 2 months one of the lace clips broke and all the rubber is coming off on the bottom, had my other pair for 8 years , have 8 pairs of keen boots , but after this pair will not be ordering any more... what a disappointment!
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: The new pair fits just like the first pair did (when new)
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair of Keen Voyageur Mid Boots i have purchased. I put about 300 miles on the first pair so it was definitely time for a new pair. The new pair fits just like the first pair did (when new).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits very nice good hiking boot
customer_reviews.text: Really like the look an fit very comfortable but unfortunately mine aren't water proof first time I stepped in a couple inches of water my socks were wet
customer_reviews.author: Owen Guile

customer_reviews.title: nice and light
customer_reviews.text: fits my foot very well and is light too. very good grip
customer_reviews.author: ralf r.

customer_reviews.title: Poor Sole
customer_reviews.text: I've owned several pairs of Keens. They have all been comfortable shoes for teaching in, which requires standing and walking several hours a day. Unfortunately, this pair is quite poorly made. After three months of use most of it walking and standing indoors, the outer sole on the right shoe has begun to peel off.
customer_reviews.author: Paul K

customer_reviews.title: Positive Footbox
customer_reviews.text: These Keen boots are the beast! I've worn combat boots and transitioned to Asolo's for deployment a few years. These are hugging my feet and making them think it's time to walk again. If you need positive foot contact within a boot, well this is it. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as I had hoped! ☹️
customer_reviews.text: Shoe is very comfortable right out if the box. The main complaint is the tongue is too short and the laces make their way above the tongue and then the show is loose and needs to be retired multiple times during the day. Please fix as I really like your shoes otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: really like these Keens because they are not waterproof and breath ...
customer_reviews.text: really like these Keens because they are not waterproof and breath well. the Keens are the only shoe that i have found that have consistent enough sizing that i will but them on-line. good boots that fit nearly perfect the first day.
customer_reviews.author: mielkemouse

customer_reviews.title: Great light boots
customer_reviews.text: Second pair of these. Great fit, very comfortable and have held up well. The first pair has hundreds of miles on them. I expect these to wear just as well. Update: on my 4th pair, can't be happier with these boots. I've tried other models and none of them fit as well as these. Wonderful boots!
customer_reviews.author: Treker

customer_reviews.title: It's a great shoe just expect it to disintegrate within a year
customer_reviews.text: A great form-fitting very comfortable shoe that is very tough and rigid but literally disintegrates after a year.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Stratton

customer_reviews.title: These are truly great hiking boots
customer_reviews.text: These are truly great hiking boots. I wore them on my hiking trip to Alaska and they held up great. I did break them in before leaving. Could not have asked for a better set of boots. For the price they were a steal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I use these for hiking and for construction work and hold up very well
customer_reviews.text: I will only buy Keen. I'm on my 4th pair now.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last
customer_reviews.text: The sides and bottom of the boot are already falling off. I wear these around the yard a few times a year. Upset that I spent money on them and they can't make it a year.
customer_reviews.author: Bert Melchner

customer_reviews.title: first pair of keens. absolutely love them.
customer_reviews.text: The first thing I noticed when I took them out of the box is how light they are compared to my Asolos. I was also astonished at how they felt like they were already "broken in" the first time I put them on. After three days of wearing them around, I wore them on a 13.5 mile hike. No problem. No blisters. Super comfortable. Good and supportive. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Good fit
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used several hiking boot manufacturers over the years. I like a little wider fit for comfort. I’ll probably not buy any other brand than keen in the future.
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: It's a good shoe, just that the 15 is a little ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a good shoe, just that the 15 is a little tight so I need a 16 but they don't make. I am able to wear for light yard duties, but not for long hikes.
customer_reviews.author: Steven H. Larsen

customer_reviews.title: Great boots for daily wear.
customer_reviews.text: Great boots. I'm on my feet all day on concrete. Keen shoes are well built, comfortable and true to size.
customer_reviews.author: SFreed

customer_reviews.title: Customer service, think again.
customer_reviews.text: I have worn them less then ten times and an eyelet holding the laces broke. Have reached out twice and no response from Keen. I own 3 pairs of Keen shoes and have had no issues. But if this is how they handle a defective product try a different brand. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm a contractor and I buy a new pair every summer and a water proof pair every winter and I love them. I won't wear anything el
customer_reviews.text: This was approximately my 12th pair, I'm a contractor and I buy a new pair every summer and a water proof pair every winter and I love them. I won't wear anything else, my 3 sons use to make fun of me but now that they are older and working they have them too
customer_reviews.author: DMS

customer_reviews.title: Fine boots, a bit large
customer_reviews.text: Ordered same size as old pair. These seem larger. Edited review due to previous review was for a different item.
customer_reviews.author: Ripstones

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and feel, wish better waterproofing
customer_reviews.text: Wish they were more waterproof, next model up has the better waterproofing. If you don’t need the waterproof, just doing dry hiking, these are great.
customer_reviews.author: D. Heinkel

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable boot....
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair of these exact pair of boots and the fit is the same for all of them. I am over 60 with feet sensitivity caused by lack of natural foot cushion. These are the most comfortable, light weight boot I have found.
customer_reviews.author: rocky scheving

customer_reviews.title: Love em.
customer_reviews.text: These are my second pair. My first pair I wore almost every day for 3 years. They fit like a glove. I could sleep in these boots. Don't hesitate. You won't be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Blankenship

customer_reviews.title: Ultra light
customer_reviews.text: Lightest hiker I've ever bought. I use KEEN work boots for their comfort so I bought these. Im normally an 11 but had to get 11.5 in these and the right boot seems a bit shorter than the left. Hopefully this is just part of the break in.
customer_reviews.author: Mysammich

customer_reviews.title: Keens are the best shoes made in my book
customer_reviews.text: Keens are the best shoes made in my book. They are very well made and fit nicely. Long lasting, I get about three years out of each pair wearing them 365 days a year. Will never buy another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: OK boots
customer_reviews.text: Bought these boots to replace my Merrells which were great and never gave me any problems. Boot is wide and very comfortable. Went on a few short hikes and so far it's good to go. Construction at sole to side looks sketchy and hope the glue holds up. IMO the boots look like mickey mouse shoes, but if they are comfortable and hold up, who cares?
customer_reviews.author: C. R. Lee

customer_reviews.title: The toe box is pretty huge on these
customer_reviews.text: The toe box is pretty huge on these, not sure if a smaller size would have helped. When I was trekking downhill my toes got pretty sore from moving around all over the place. Otherwise, they worked out great.
customer_reviews.author: H Man

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous boot.
customer_reviews.text: I am replacing an identical shoe that I have had for 8 or nine years . I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Possibly mislabeled wrong size
customer_reviews.text: I have these exact same boots I bought from a local store which are the right size... These I bought from Amazon are smaller, almost like they are mis-sized...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Product appears well built.
customer_reviews.text: They are a light hiking boot good for warmer weather. The sole of a little softer than some that are heaver (ex. Asolo), but good if you are not in severe rocky or bad trail conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Martin K. in VA

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: The boots were too small. I returned them after just trying them on.
customer_reviews.author: Verne L. Wright

product_meta.title: KEEN Men's Voyageur Mid Hiking Boot
product_meta.description: Keep your cool under pressure with the voyageur hiking shoe from KEEN. Mesh lining replaces a waterproof barrier for continual airflow. The rugged outsole finds a sure grip on rough terrain with multi-directional lugs. An ess shank is built in for torsion.
feature_bullets: Lace-up leather hiking boot featuring looped eyelets and removable insole
